alert.note: Alert for Madera (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 12 at 5:09PM PDT until March 12 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Madera, Mariposa and Merced. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 509 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Merced, Madera, Atwater, Chowchilla, Livingston, Mendota, Firebaugh, Winton, Madera Acres, Parkwood, Parksdale, Delhi, Biola, Hilmar-Irwin, Bonadelle Ranchos- Madera Ranchos, Dos Palos, Planada, Le Grand and Lake McClure. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
